content.value: A web server is software that delivers web pages to users over the internet or a local network.
content.example: Example: Hosting a website that users can access using a browser.

content.value: Web servers are the backbone of the internet. They host websites, web applications, and APIs. Linux is the most popular platform for web servers because it is stable, secure, and efficient. Learning how to install and manage a web server is a key skill for system administrators and DevOps engineers.
Web servers are the backbone of the internet. They host websites, web applications, and APIs. Linux is the most popular platform for web servers because it is stable, secure, and efficient.
Both Apache and Nginx are popular web servers. Apache is easy to configure and beginner-friendly, while Nginx is lightweight and performs better under heavy traffic.
